'Lilium' (members of which are true lilies) is a genus of herbaceous flowering
plants growing from bulbs, all with large prominent flowers. Lilies are a group
of flowering plants which are important in culture and literature in much of the
world. Most species are native to the temperate northern hemisphere, though
their range extends into the northern subtropics. Many other plants have "lily"
in their common name but are not related to true lilies.
